intro: Stylidium roseoalatum, commonly known as the pink-stemmed sun-orchid, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its unique, erect, and often hairy stems. The plant produces showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Stylidium roseoalatum is known for its rapid growth and short lifespan, often blooming and setting seed within a few weeks.
